author: freep.com
title: Best-selling books: ‘Murder House,’ ‘Killing Reagan’
text:
MORE FICTION
■ 1. “The Murder House” by James Patterson and David Ellis (Little, Brown)
■ 2. “The Girl in the Spider’s Web” by David Lagercrantz (Knopf)
■ 3. “Come Rain or Come Shine” by Jan Karon (G.P. Putnam’s Sons)
■ 4. “After You” by Jojo Moyes (Pamela Dorman Books)
■ 5 . “Make Me” by Lee Child (Delacorte Press)
■ 6. “Go Set a Watchman” by Harper Lee (HarperCollins)
■ 7. “The Cinder Spires: The Aeronaut’s Windlass” by Jim Butcher(Roc)
■ 8. “The Girl on the Train” by Paula Hawkins (Riverhead)
■ 9. “Pretty Girls” by Karin Slaughter (William Morrow)
■ 10. “X” by Sue Grafton (Marian Wood Books/Putnam)
NONFICTION
■ 1. “Killing Reagan” by Bill O’Reilly (Holt)
■ 2. “The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up” by Marie Kondo (Ten Speed)
■ 3. “Big Magic” by Elizabeth Gilbert (Riverhead)
■ 4. “Live Love Lead” by Brian Houston (Hachette/Faith/Words)
■ 5. “Why Not Me?” by Mindy Kaling (Crown Archetype)
■ 6. “Is This Together” by Ann Romney (St. Martin’s Press/Dunne)
■ 7. “The 20/20 Diet” by Phil McGraw (Bird Street Books)
■ 8 . “Furiously Happy” by Jenny Lawson (Flatiron Books)
■ 9. “Between the World and Me” by Ta-Nehisi Coates (Random/Spiegel & Grau)
■ 10. “Rising Strong” by Brene Brown (Spiegel & Grau)
Source: Publishers Weekly. Week ending Oct. 4.
